news_header: The Finnish Food Authority has reduced its workforce due to operational savings, resulting in layoffs and exclusions.
news_text: The Finnish Food Authority has laid off 20 employees and excluded 53 others for various reasons, leading to a reduction in personnel from 93 to 73. The agency indicated that these changes would impact service levels, potentially causing delays in customer service. A correction noted that the number of dismissed individuals was 20 out of the total reductions.
